title: Katie Price 'hiding' distinctive pink Range Rover from creditors ahead of fresh bankruptcy case
text:

Katie Price faces further financial woe after falling behind with payments to her creditors.

The 41-year-old mum of five is due back in court next week to face a fresh bankruptcy petition, a year after she promised to pay off her debts through the use of an individual voluntary arrangement (IVA).

It appears from paperwork filed against her notorious mucky mansion that the ex-glamour model has fallen behind on repayments and now risks losing her West Sussex home.

She was supposed to be paying back £12,000 a month over four years, but is still splashing the cash on renovation projects , trips abroad and more plastic surgery .

But a pal says Katie is determined not to let her beloved bright pink £75,000 Range Rover be seized as an asset and has made arrangements to "hide" it from her creditors.

(Image: YouTube)

(Image: Vantagenews.com)

The distinctive Barbie pink 4x4 - which Mirror Online can reveal has been left untaxed since August 1, 2019 - has been parked away from her home to avoid detection by eagle-eyed bailiffs, says the insider.

It is on loan from a dealer and so needs to be returned when Katie's lease is up shortly.

"She's told a few of her close friends that her car was going to be repossessed a few weeks ago so she hid it from the creditors to ensure it would go back to the garage that loaned it to her," our source told Mirror Online.

"She's worried bailiffs will come to the house and take it, so she's moved it in a garage a few miles away.

"At the time she took out the car, she was told that if she doesn't return it then the dealer would have to report it to the police as stolen, which is why she is hiding it to ensure it gets back to the dealer."

(Image: GC Images)

The insider went on: "She says she's not bothered about not driving it because it brought her too much attention - but that's the reason she loved it so much, everyone knew her car.

"It became iconic to her and fans would wait near it when it was parked so they could meet her when she came back."

The Range Rover was part of her IVA, but the pal claims Katie never saw its repayments as a priority and hasn't paid the dealer in months.

(Image: SplashNews.com)

"Katie had a fleet of cars at one point on her drive but over the past few months they have gradually been disappearing," they went on.

"She doesn't seem bothered, she has asked her friend to arrange another Range Rover for her through one of her contacts.

"She's also convinced the babysitter, Lauryn Cook, to drive her up and down the country as a paid chauffeur.

"She won't hand it back to the dealer herself because she's embarrassed by the situation."

(Image: SplashNews.com)

Just last month, Katie announced herself she would be getting rid of her fleet of pink motors because "they get me into trouble" following several driving bans and fines for speeding, driving without insurance and being drunk in charge of a vehicle.

She was forced to take down the eBay listing for her pink Barbie Suzuki Vitara in January this year after the car dealership selling it for her was inundated with online abuse and joke bids.

She also flogged off her garish Fiat Ducato horsebox last year after it failed to sell on eBay - despite her knocking £130,000 off the asking price - and downgraded to a £2,500 horsebox in which to transport her beloved nags.

But just last week Katie herself revealed she has her eye on a £45,000 replacement Range Rover, amid her spiralling financial problems.

(Image: Instagram)

"I can't wait to get my new car next week," she said on her YouTube channel on September 27.

"I'm going to go for a Range Rover Velar. I just like the look of them. They're sleek and look cool, just like me...

"I normally have the bigger ones, but just like the shape of them. It comes next week."

She added: "I've still got my pink Range Rover.

"It's in the garage, but I don't drive it because I always get pulled over.

"I want to get rid of it."

(Image: Youtube)

The old Range Rover suffered extensive damage when it crashed into a hedge last October, following a boozy night out to celebrate Katie's boyfriend Kris Boyson's 30th birthday.

Katie had tried to argue in court that she was not in control of the 4x4 in the early hours of October, insisting a mystery man had driven, but the judge ruled Katie was not a 'credible' witness.

He found her guilty of being in charge of the vehicle while over the legal limit.

The three-month driving ban was added to another from earlier in the year when Katie was summoned to court for getting behind the wheel while disqualified and uninsured.

(Image: Youtube)

(Image: PA)

Katie was spotted driving a Ford Fiesta near her Sussex home, later claiming she wrongly believed that an earlier road ban for speeding had expired.

Paul Macaulay, defending Katie at Crawley Magistrates' Court in January, said his client was by her own admission 'not the best' at paperwork.

The mum-of-five was was disqualified for a further three months and fined £1,100.

Katie was given 14 days to settle the bill after telling the judge she was not able to pay the full amount on the day.

Katie's rep has declined to comment.
description: EXCLUSIVE: Katie Price is facing another bankruptcy battle after falling behind with payments on her IVA - and could face having her Barbie pink car seized
